qna.a: This task is time consuming, stressful and complex for most people. are you aware that our firm is trained and experienced in settling debts? Why spend all your time and effort trying to negotiate on your own when you can rely on our experience to get the best settlements possible? Having an attorney to assist you throughout this process is an extremely valuable tool since many collection companies will act unscrupulously to collect from you. Based on our experience, we know what works. We know creditor procedures, and we know the timing for when it is best to contact creditors and negotiate a settlement. Creditors know that when they are dealing with us, we are fully aware of their processes, as well as what settlements are reachable, and what settlements are not. Based on your hardship, we contact your creditors and get you the best possible settlement. It might be in your best interests to leave the negotiating up to trained professionals. We can't guarantee that our settlements would be better than yours, but I can say that we have data about your creditors that you don't have, and we can attempt to settle multiple client accounts all at once with a single collector which is leverage in the process that you also don't have. We are confident that you will be pleased with our performance once we are done.

qna.a: As part of the program, you have agreed to set-aside and save a fixed amount of money each month. This is based on the total amount of debt you enrolled. That amount will be deposited monthly to your specialty savings account. The specialty account makes both the settlement and payment process easier and more secure. As the savings account builds each month, we are working towards agreeable settlements with your creditors. Once a settlement offer is negotiated and approved, we will reach out to you to obtain your authorization.

qna.a: I am only able to provide general information about Bankruptcy. Only your attorney can tell you how a bankruptcy would affect you and what type of bankruptcy you would or would not qualify for. The two types of Bankruptcy that most often pertain to consumers are Chapter 7 and Chapter 13. Chapter 7 is where all of the debt is discharged through the Bankruptcy and the process takes about 3-5 months. Chapter 13 is a repayment plan that is managed by a Trustee who is appointed by the Court. A Chapter 13 can take 3-5 years and the Debtor may not have to pay back all of their debts. Bankruptcy is highly regulated, and it is more difficult to qualify for a Chapter 7 bankruptcy than it once was. Given those challenges our debt settlement program might be a better option for you.

qna.a: Creditors are allowed to report settled debts exceeding $600 as a loss to the IRS. Creditors may issue a 1099 for forgiven debt. If that happens the loss must also be reported by you as income. However, the IRS may permit you to write off this amount if you were insolvent at the time. You should consult with your tax preparer for specific advice on the tax consequences of forgiven debt and how it would apply to your situation.

qna.a: Our debt resolution program is designed for anyone in financial hardship who is falling behind or having problems making minimum payments to creditors on their unsecured debts. You must have a minimum of $7,500 in total unsecured debt and a minimum of $500 of unsecured debt with each individual creditor.  You must also be able to make consistent monthly savings deposits on time for the duration of your estimate program term.

qna.a: We've settled debts with every major creditor out there and many creditors you've probably never heard of.  However, we still cannot guarantee that every creditor will settle because individual results vary based on the specifics of each client's debt. The same creditor may agree on a settlement for one client who made years worth of payments on a debt, but refuse to settle for another client who made only a single payment towards a debt. This is just one example. Successful completion of your debt resolution program requires setting aside enough funds in your specialty savings account until all enrolled debts are resolved.

qna.a: As part of the program, you have agreed to set-aside and save a fixed amount of money each month. This is based on the total amount of debt you enrolled. That amount will be deposited monthly to your specialty savings account. The specialty account makes both the settlement and payment process easier and more secure. As the savings account builds each month, we are working towards agreeable settlements with your creditors. Once a settlement offer is negotiated and approved, we will reach out to you to obtain your authorization.  The creditor may set-up an installment settlement or a lump sum settlement. An installment settlement is a settlement that is paid over time with fixed payments totaling the amount of the final settlement.  A lump sum settlement is a specified amount of money paid in one payment.

qna.a: Receiving a lawsuit can be stressful, but rest assured, as part of our debt resolution program you have full legal representation. Lawsuits are time sensitive so please contact us immediately and send the documents in a legible manner ASAP. Our team will review the case, file the necessary responses, and represent you throughout the legal process. It’s essential that you don’t ignore the lawsuit. We will negotiate with your creditors to try to resolve the matter before it reaches court. Stay in touch with us and continue making your program deposits to keep your account in good standing. Remember that your Guardian attorney deals with creditor lawsuits every day and is highly experienced in resolving them.

qna.a: Our program itself is not a loan. You are enrolled in a debt settlement program for people who are in financial hardship. You have retained Guardian Litigation Group to settle your debts for less than what you owe. However, because of our relationship with certain lenders you may be able to apply for a loan after making your program deposits on time.  If you were to be approved, this loan would be funded directly to your savings account to speed up your debt settlement program. The loan funds would be used to pay off your enrolled debts at reduced amounts negotiated by Guardian. That would speed up your program greatly.

qna.a: The great thing about our program is that there are NO upfront fees, out-of-pocket expenses, and NO down payments. We do not charge you anything until we have successfully negotiated a debt!  Your monthly deposits all build up in your savings account until a settlement is obtained.  The costs are already worked into your monthly program deposit.  We work on what is known as a contingency or performance fee.  That means, if we don't get results for you, we don't get paid!  Our company charges  27% of your enrolled debt amount.  And remember, we do not charge you ANYTHING until payment is made on a settlement.

qna.a: If a judgment is obtained from a lawsuit brought on by a creditor, your wages may be garnished, depending on the state you reside in. Garnishment does not happen easily and it does require a judgment from a creditor. In the event a collector attempts to garnish your wages, one of our negotiators or the attorney in your state will be in immediate contact with your creditor’s attorney to try working out a settlement as soon as possible. The attorney in your state can also assist in providing documents you can file to dispute the garnishment depending on your situation. It is important to remember that a garnishment is not possible without a judgment.

qna.a: Our debt resolution program is not designed to improve your credit score, as we are not a credit repair service. While some clients may see their credit improve after resolving their debts, this is not the goal of our services. Our primary focus is on helping you become debt-free, which can provide a foundation for future financial health. Your credit score may initially be affected, but by eliminating debt, you’ll be in a better position to rebuild your financial standing after completing the program. Please consult with a credit expert if improving your score is a priority.

qna.a: Receiving a lawsuit can be stressful, but rest assured, as part of our debt resolution program you have full legal representation. Lawsuits are time sensitive so please contact us immediately and send the documents in a legible manner ASAP. Our team will review the case, file the necessary responses, and represent you throughout the legal process. It’s essential that you don’t ignore the lawsuit. We will negotiate with your creditors to try to resolve the matter before it reaches court. Stay in touch with us and continue making your program deposits to keep your account in good standing. Remember that your Guardian attorney deals with creditor lawsuits every day and is highly experienced in resolving them.

qna.a: Legitimate negative marks on a credit report cannot be removed. Our debt resolution program is not designed to improve your credit score, as we are not a credit repair service. While some clients may see their credit improve after resolving their debts, this is not the goal of our services. Our primary focus is on helping you become debt-free, which can provide a foundation for future financial health. Your credit score may initially be affected, but by eliminating debt, you’ll be in a better position to rebuild your financial standing after completing the program. Please consult with a credit expert if improving your score is a priority.

qna.a: Your set aside savings account is with an FDIC insured bank. It is not identical to a regular bank account, and it is shielded from access by creditors and collectors. You have full access to your account online and the funds in the account are in your control.

qna.a: We recommend you do not use or apply for credit until all your debts have been settled. Your creditors still have access to your credit report. If they notice that you are continuing to add charges on your credit accounts, the likelihood that they will negotiate is reduced because they will believe that you have the means to pay them. You must also completely stop using your enrolled accounts immediately, if you haven't already done so.
